title: Infographic: The Vaccination Effect on Covid-19 Deaths
author: Martin Armstrong
description: This chart shows Covid-19 related deaths in England in 2021 by vaccination status.
cleaned_text: One major positive effect of Covid-19 vaccinations have been made plainly apparent in new [Office for National Statistics data](https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/birthsdeathsandmarriages/deaths/articles/deathsinvolvingcovid19byvaccinationstatusengland/deathsoccurringbetween2januaryand2july2021) for England. As this infographic shows, of all Covid-related deaths in the country from 2 January to 2 July 2021, 37.4 percent of these were people that had not yet been vaccinated to any degree against the illness. The fast-working vaccinations limited the share of people dying within 21 days of their first jab to 23.5 percent, while the efficacy of a second-dose is really shown - just 1.6 of deaths occurred in people who had been vaccinated twice up to 21 days prior, and a minimal 0.8 percent once these 21 days had passed.
